statements.query: MATCH (n:RedshiftCluster)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE n.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH n LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DETACH DELETE (n) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: Delete RedshiftClusters that no longer exist and DETACH them from all nodes they were previously connected to.

statements.query: MATCH (:RedshiftCluster)<-[r:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE r.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH r LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DELETE (r) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: If a RedshiftCluster still exists but is no longer associated with its old AWS Account, delete the relationship between them.

statements.query: MATCH (:EC2SecurityGroup)<-[r:MEMBER_OF_EC2_SECURITY_GROUP]-(:RedshiftCluster)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE r.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH r LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DELETE (r) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: If a RedshiftCluster still exists and is no longer a part of its old EC2SecurityGroup, delete the relationship between them.

statements.query: MATCH (:AWSPrincipal)<-[r:STS_ASSUMEROLE_ALLOW]-(:RedshiftCluster)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE r.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH r LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DELETE (r) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: If a RedshiftCluster still exists but can no longer assume a previously set IAM role, delete the relationship between them.

statements.query: MATCH (:AWSVpc)<-[r:MEMBER_OF_AWS_VPC]-(:RedshiftCluster)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE r.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH r LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DELETE (r) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: Delete stale relationships between RedshiftClusters and VPCs.
